summary:
The Security Council,
Recalling previous resolutions on terrorism, reaffirms that terrorism is one of the most serious threats to peace and security.
Welcoming the UN Global Counter-Terrorism Strategy and creation of the Counter-Terrorism Implementation Task Force,
Reminding States to ensure counter-terrorism measures comply with international law, 
Commending Member States' cooperation with the Counter-Terrorism Committee.

1. Decides to extend the initial period referred to in resolution 1535 (2004) until 31 March 2008;
2. Requests the Executive Director to recommend changes to the organizational plan within 60 days, in consultation with Council members, and submit them to the Counter-Terrorism Committee;
3. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
